results.title: Oboe and coranglais
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. In this film professional musicians show how the oboe and the coranglais are played, demonstrate their range and tone, and show how to care for them. Musicians: Rosemary Stimson, Jiri Tancibudek.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: The World of animals: looking at amphibians
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Studies frogs, toads and salamanders to show how amphibians are adapted to spend their early life in water and their adult life on land. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.title_for_label: The World of animals: looking at amphibians
results.description:

results.title: Flowering plants and their parts
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Relates the roots, stems and leaves of plants to plant growth and reproduction. Illustrates the ability of plants to adapt to their environment.

results.title: Your protection against disease
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Illustrates how germs spread disease, how the body controls micro organisms that enter the body and how good hygiene habits prevent disease.

Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
